### üë®‚ÄçüöÄ This task is assigned to @m-andreev 

## 1Ô∏è‚É£ Write application which prints the Multiplication Table up to 10 and merge your file with the [karastoyanov / linux-hobby-club / development](https://github.com/karastoyanov/linux-hobby-club/) branch
### 1Ô∏è‚É£.1Ô∏è‚É£ Fork the original [repository](https://github.com/karastoyanov/linux-hobby-club) to your personal account

### 1Ô∏è‚É£.2Ô∏è‚É£ Clone the repository with git clone inside your Debian VM. ‚ö†Ô∏è Use the SSH URL address, not HTTPS

### 1Ô∏è‚É£.3Ô∏è‚É£ Inside the repository you will find different directories for each programming language (Default Languages are: Python, JavaScript, C#, Java, C++)

### 1Ô∏è‚É£.4Ô∏è‚É£ Optionally create new branch into your repository called multiplication-table

### 1Ô∏è‚É£.5Ô∏è‚É£ Choose your preferable programming language and open it's directory. Do not forget to switch the branch if you created a new one to work on it for this task.

### 1Ô∏è‚É£.6Ô∏è‚É£ Create new file with name `Your Name`.`Multiplication Table up to 10`.`your programming language extension`

     ‚úÖ Bonus points if you kept the right convention for naming the file for the programming language you chose
### 1Ô∏è‚É£.7Ô∏è‚É£ Write a simple application which receives a single input -> integer between 1 and 10 and prints the multiplication table for the respective integer, each operation on a new line.

### ‚û°Ô∏è Example User input --> 1:

`1 x 1 = 1`

`1 x 2 = 2`

`1 x 3 = 3`

`...`

     ‚úÖ Bonus - Write a simple and easily understandable String messages for the inputs and output of your program.

     ‚úÖ Bonus - Try to keep your code clean and simple. If your code consists of more than one file, separate your files in a sub-directory

     ‚úÖ Bonus - Write additional IF-statements, e.g., what happens if the user enters char or double instead of integer.

     ‚úÖ Bonus - Implement additional functionality to your program to print the entire multiplication table for the number from 1 to 10, instead for a specific integer.

     ‚úÖ Bonus - Add comments to your program to explain your approach, add your name as author, etc. Be creative.
### 1Ô∏è‚É£.8Ô∏è‚É£ After you are done, commit your changes to your repository

### 1Ô∏è‚É£.9Ô∏è‚É£ Open your GitHub repository and check if your program has been uploaded in the correct directory.

### 1Ô∏è‚É£.1Ô∏è‚É£0Ô∏è‚É£ Open a new Pull Request to merge your last modifications will the parent repository [karastoyanov / linux-hobby-club](https://github.com/karastoyanov/linux-hobby-club/).

      ‚ö†Ô∏è Open the pull-request from <your-repo> / <your-working-branch> to <development> branch of the parent repo.
      ‚úÖ Bonus - Write clean and understandable Title and Description of the Pull Request. Include as much as possible details.
### ‚ÑπÔ∏è If the assignment is done properly, your pull request will be merged to the development branch of the parent repository.
